t: Psalm 37
A Psalm of David.
Fret*p not thyself because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the workers of iniquity.
For*p they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the green herb.
Trust*p in the Lord,*s and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.
Delight*p thyself also in the Lord;*s and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
Commit*p thy way unto the Lord;*s trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
And*p he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
Rest*p in the Lord,*s and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.
Cease*p from anger, and forsake wrath: fret not thyself in any wise to do evil.
For*p evildoers shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the Lord,*s they shall inherit the earth.
For*p yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and it shall not be.
But*p the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
The*p wicked plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.
The*p Lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that his day is coming.
The*p wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright conversation.
Their*p sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.
A*p little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.
For*p the arms of the wicked shall be broken: but the Lord*s upholdeth the righteous.
The*p Lord*s knoweth the days of the upright: and their inheritance shall be for ever.
They*p shall not be ashamed in the evil time: and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
But*p the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the Lord*s shall be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they consume away.
The*p wicked borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous sheweth mercy, and giveth.
For*p such as be blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and they that be cursed of him shall be cut off.
The*p steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord:*s and he delighteth in his way.
Though*p he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down: for the Lord*s upholdeth him with his hand.
I*p have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.
He*p is ever merciful, and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.
Depart*p from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.
For*p the Lord*s loveth judgment, and forsaketh not his saints; they are preserved for ever: but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.
The*p righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.
The*p mouth of the righteous speaketh wisdom, and his tongue talketh of judgment.
The*p law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps shall slide.
The*p wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.
The*p Lord*s will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
Wait*p on the Lord,*s and keep his way, and he shall exalt thee to inherit the land: when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.
I*p have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a green bay tree.
Yet*p he passed away, and, lo, he was not: yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.
Mark*p the perfect man, and behold the upright: for the end of that man is peace.
But*p the transgressors shall be destroyed together: the end of the wicked shall be cut off.
But*p the salvation of the righteous is of the Lord:*s he is their strength in the time of trouble.
And*p the Lord*s shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and save them, because they trust in him.
